TopicTitle: [1.6.x] Distant Object Enhancement bis v1.9.1.1 (16 October 2018) - Free to a Good Home

Articles.Content: Which alternate color config should I use with 6.4x kerbal system? Should I keep it stock?
Have I mentioned how much I like this mod? Because it's a lot.

this is bugging me. Am I really just noticing it for the first time or is there an issue here?

The left edge of the images is the left edge of my screen. Not sure why I have to move the sun so far over to get the stars to fully disappear. Skybox dimming is set to 75% where I've always had it...
Not working for me, i have .90 and using renaissance with the toolbar. any ideas?

Anyone else had an issue with objects like minmus looking like they have a moon, due to the fact that Distant Object is adding a flare for it, but is mistakenly putting it to the side, even when the object is visible?

this is bugging me. Am I really just noticing it for the first time or is there an issue here?

Yeah, it's super awkward... I flipped out about that last page, kinda sorta (not exactly, but the dimming could use a rework, eh).

Anyone else had an issue with objects like minmus looking like they have a moon, due to the fact that Distant Object is adding a flare for it, but is mistakenly putting it to the side, even when the object is visible?

Yeah, I've noticed that too. Most of the time it's just for a second or two until it refreshes, try changing the camera angle a bit maybe?

Also, no matter what I've tried, my vessel names never show up when I hover the flares. Yes, everything is set properly. It worked once... so I know it can happen... but either the area I have to hover over is so tiny that I never hit it... or it's not working for me... I see the flares fine, just no names when for my my satellites like when I hover over the planet flares...

Yeah, it's super awkward... I flipped out about that last page, kinda sorta (not exactly, but the dimming could use a rework, eh).

Yeah, I've noticed that too. Most of the time it's just for a second or two until it refreshes, try changing the camera angle a bit maybe?

Also, no matter what I've tried, my vessel names never show up when I hover the flares. Yes, everything is set properly. It worked once... so I know it can happen... but either the area I have to hover over is so tiny that I never hit it... or it's not working for me... I see the flares fine, just no names when for my my satellites like when I hover over the planet flares...

These are all issues I will work on when I have time. Unfortunately, I've got two other mods that are higher priority for my modding time, and since I didn't write this mod initially, I don't have as good of a grasp on it as I otherwise would. I have ideas on the vessel names and the misplaced planet flare problem. I think vessel flares are sometimes visible when they shouldn't be, and the threshold for when the text shows up is set too high, as well. I have a partial fix on that locally, but it's not ready to post yet. You can also occasionally see other flares jumping - it's really obvious if your vessel is in polar orbit (I watched Jool jump several diameters every few seconds the other day). I haven't looked into the root cause on that one yet.

These are all issues I will work on when I have time. Good to hear mate, and thanks for the work you've done to keep this going.

I think that shot would be 100% less interesting without DOE.

I think vessel flares are sometimes visible when they shouldn't be

Definitely this, IMO. I can clearly see, for example, that Minmus is being rendered as an object but the flare is still trying to overlay itself upon it

I'm not sure I understand what all the options in this mod do. What I'm looking for is a way to keep the enhanced distance when viewing space stations and ships you are approaching without killing the skybox. What setting do I use to do that? I tried disabling dynamic sky dimming, but it didn't seem to do that (not sure what it did really).

I'm not sure I understand what all the options in this mod do. What I'm looking for is a way to keep the enhanced distance when viewing space stations and ships you are approaching without killing the skybox. What setting do I use to do that? I tried disabling dynamic sky dimming, but it didn't seem to do that (not sure what it did really).

Disabling dynamic sky dimming is what you want (uncheck it in the dialog, hit apply, of course - I just double checked that it's working). That said, stock KSP has its own sky dimming when the sun is visible. There's nothing I can do about that - all this plugin does is to cause sky dimming when the day side of a planet / moon is visible and nearby.

Maybe I didn't hit apply. I'll try again.

EDIT: Working now. Sorry for the confusion.

Maybe I didn't hit apply. I'll try again.

EDIT: Working now. Sorry for the confusion.

Not a problem. I've debated keeping the Apply button, versus making changes take effect immediately, so the effects they cause are obvious.
I've had problems with dynamic skybox dimming option not setting as well. I'm not a fan of the dimming and it's annoying that it keeps coming back.

I've had problems with dynamic skybox dimming option not setting as well. I'm not a fan of the dimming and it's annoying that it keeps coming back.

I plan on giving that code some attention next.

In the meantime, DOE v1.5.2 is available. Not really anything new from an end-user perspective, although I think I've got the "Minmus and its flare" bug fixed.

Edited April 16, 2015 by darqen27

I had posted about this in the texture replacer mod thread once, but it didn't seem like it would be possible via that mod.

I'm looking for a mod that can make less of the skybox visible while on the surface of a body with atmosphere and you are on the night side. My original idea was to use texture replacer to add a second skybox behind the first. The first one would contain gas clouds, nebulas, galaxies and other phenomenon that are not normally visible from within atmosphere. That layer would have it's alpha level dropped as you plunge into atmosphere, and vice versa. It should never reach 100% either, so that you can always see the same stars behind/through it.

Seems that my idea would require a plugin of it's own, which I have no idea how to write. Perhaps this is a feature you may want to explore.

Distant Object v1.5.3 is now live. This is a KSP 1.0 compatibility release. I don't think any existing issues were fixed, and there's a chance I introduced new ones. But at least I got the update posted on the day of release (for my time zone).

Git it on GitHub or KerbalStuff
